content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Sure, here's a Julia function that implements the desired behavior:
```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    filter(word -> startswith(word, 'A') || startswith(word, 'B') ||
                   startswith(word, 'C') || startswith(word, 'D') ||
                   startswith(word, 'E') || startswith(word, 'F') ||
                   startswith(word, 'G') || startswith(word, 'H') ||
                   startswith(word, 'I') || startswith(word, 'J') ||
                   startswith(word, 'K') || startswith(word, 'L') ||
                   startswith(word, 'M') || startswith(word, 'N') ||
                   startswith(word, 'O') || startswith(word, 'P') ||
                   startswith(word, 'Q') || startswith(word, 'R') ||
                   startswith(word, 'S') || startswith(word, 'T') ||
                   startswith(word, 'U') || startswith(word, 'V') ||
                   startswith(word, 'W') || startswith(word, 'X') ||
                   startswith(word, 'Y') || startswith(word, 'Z'),
           words)
end
```
Note that this function uses the `filter` function to create a new array that contains only the words from the input array that start with a capital letter. The `startswith` function is used to check if a word starts with a capital letter.

However, this solution assumes that the input is an array of strings. If the input is a `Vector{String}` or any other type of collection that implements the `AbstractVector` interface, you can simplify the function as follows:
```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    filter(word -> startswith(word, capitalcase(word)[1]), words)
end
```
This version of the function checks if the first character of each word is a capital letter by comparing it to the first character of the word in capital case (using the `capitalcase` function). This solution is more concise and works with any type of collection that implements the `AbstractVector` interface.
